reviewText:
This game is definitely worth playing. The gameplay is very simple, but that's what makes it fun.

The tutorial isn't completely clear, but it does give basic controls you need to know. There are more advanced controls such as rolling, as well as weapon swing and shield mechanics but you'll learn that on your own.

The graphics are that of ancient greek art, which makes it interesting.

The community, well, is fine. No one seems to use the chat function, so you rarely see anyone communicate. On the other hand, there are plenty of players. You can host a game and wait a few minutes. Soon, players will begin to join until it reaches the max of 8.

When it comes to gamemodes, there's DM, TDM, and Elimination. There seem to be no objective-based gamemodes, which isn't bad, but it may be a nice addition.

Overall, this game is very enjoyable and fun with friends. It does feel satisfying to decapitate someone by spearing their heads. This game is free, so try it. You have got nothing to lose except your time.

reviewText: This is my new favorite 2D based game. The artwork, characters, levels. The pure design and even soundtrack of this game is put at 10/10 for me. You can pick your character skin from various past warriors, even skeletons, and a goat looking character. You have various weapons that you can use, and all of them can be thrown. Some maps are large, others are small for quick deathmatches. The game modes are deathmatch, team deathmatch, and a form of team deathmatch where once you die, you are out till the next round. So a 4v4 can quickly turn into a 1v4 if you aren't careful. It's easy setting up a match/server, and even joining others. Aside from that, you have local mode. It allows you and a friend on the same computer to play this game. This game is free, and worth trying it out. It's a game that I'll have fun playing over and over with friends. Purely awesome.

Fantastic offering into the free-to-play multiplayer arena (pun intended). Apotheon Arena is a very simple, very intense, and very bloody game that allows players to take on the roles of ancient warriors as they do battle, individually, across some very beautifully rendered artistic backgrounds. The graphics and the musical score both contribute to a wonderful atmosphere which evokes a sense of wonder for the time period and creates the perfect sense of invitation to players who want to feel like Greek gladiators, or warriors.

The controls are a little clunky (I use a controller), but it's very easy to learn and adapt to, and I appreciate it because it puts the focus on timing, execution, and how to use the various weapons available. There are a good number of options when it comes to weaponry, and each of them can, and should, be used in different ways in order to attack the other players. A good player will be knowledgable in how to utilize several weapon types, and will be able to adapt in a moments notice in order to stay flexible during a melee.

It should also be noted that many have reported various connection issues during matches, or having difficulty even getting into matches. I've only ever been able to actually join and play in a game once, with all other times providing errors. I usually just end up hosting and dont' have a problem with it then.

I do recommend it, and think it's a great game, though some players may want to take into consideration both the somewhat clunky controls, and the potential connection problems.

This is a 2D Greek themed multiplayer action platformer with three modes: elimination, deathmatch (free for all), and team deathmatch.

General:  You play in one of the three modes with or without bots against other players. The game types are standard, but in case you need clarity. Elimination is a free for all where you only live once and last person alive wins. Deathmatch is a free for all where the player with the most kills wins. Team Deathmatch is a team game where the teams the the most kills wins. But what do you get for winning a game? Nothing. There is no XP or progression of any type in this game.
Combat: In this game you have main melee weapons and a secondary ranged weapon. You will always start out with a sword and your fist. You can pick up as many weapons as you like and they'll be stored in your 1 and 2 buttons respectively. Most attacks are telegraphed and cannot be canceled. This is relevant because everyone has a sheild and may use their sheild to block basic attacks. However sheilds can break and do not guard your entire body.
Bots: Yes there are bots. You can only have a limited amount of bots, but the true value is a bit confusing. Bots typically take up spots if a player leaves the game and games can start with bots enabled. Bots have three difficulties: easy, medium, and hard. Easy plays like a human and hard has more hp and instant reflexes. I haven't bothered with medium since Easy felt like a good difficulty to put them on.
Hosting:  Easy, even without port forwarding I didn't have problems with people joining and leaving my game.
Local Co-OP: You can play local if you have a controller.
Story: Nope
Rating: I recommend it. It's reasonably fun and free, but there's nothing that will keep me playing. If anything this game defintely made me want to check out the sister game Apotheon.

This is a 2D Greek themed multiplayer action platformer with three modes: elimination, deathmatch (free for all), and team deathmatch.

General:  You play in one of the three modes with or without bots against other players. The game types are standard, but in case you need clarity. Elimination is a free for all where you only live once and last person alive wins. Deathmatch is a free for all where the player with the most kills wins. Team Deathmatch is a team game where the teams the the most kills wins. But what do you get for winning a game? Nothing. There is no XP or progression of any type in this game.
Combat: In this game you have main melee weapons and a secondary ranged weapon. You will always start out with a sword and your fist. You can pick up as many weapons as you like and they'll be stored in your 1 and 2 buttons respectively. Most attacks are telegraphed and cannot be canceled. This is relevant because everyone has a sheild and may use their sheild to block basic attacks. However sheilds can break and do not guard your entire body.
Bots: Yes there are bots. You can only have a limited amount of bots, but the true value is a bit confusing. Bots typically take up spots if a player leaves the game and games can start with bots enabled. Bots have three difficulties: easy, medium, and hard. Easy plays like a human and hard has more hp and instant reflexes. I haven't bothered with medium since Easy felt like a good difficulty to put them on.
Hosting:  Easy, even without port forwarding I didn't have problems with people joining and leaving my game.
Local Co-OP: You can play local if you have a controller.
Story: Nope
Rating: I recommend it. It's reasonably fun and free, but there's nothing that will keep me playing. If anything this game defintely made me want to check out the sister game Apotheon.
